text: Legislative Grand Committee gives consent to clauses certified as England-only: move forward 2 spaces.
Argue with Whips over timings in programme motion. Go back 1 space.
Potential backbench revolt on terms of money resolution. Go back 2 spaces.
Welsh Govt say legislative consent motion won't be passed in time. Miss a turn.
Amendments mean ways and means resolution needed. Go back 1 space.
Adverse report from Joint Committee on Human Rights. Miss a turn considering response.
Forget to signify Queen's Consent. Go back 2 spaces.
Bill manager resigns. Go back 2 spaces.
PBL Sec insist on a write-round on proposed amendment. Miss a turn.
An emergency Bill is introduced, delaying your next Commons stage by a week. Miss a turn.
A controversial Bill is dropped, leaving spare Parliamentary time. Roll the dice: roll 4 to 6, you are ready for next stage, move forward 2 spaces; roll 1 to 3, you are not ready: stay put.
Proposed Govt amendment is outside scope of the Bill; instruction to House needed. Miss a turn while this is arranged.
Money resolution does not cover proposed Govt amendment. Go back 2 spaces.
Policy found to involve state aid â€“ delay while consulting the EU Commission. Miss a turn.
Accept an Opposition amendment which addresses a problematic issue in the Bill. Roll again.
The Bill will be carried over to the next session. You need a carry over motion, a new section 19 HRA statement and revised ENs. Miss a turn.
The PBO Clerk's selection and grouping of amendments is not what was expected. Speaking notes have to be rearranged. Go back 1 space.
A group of backbench MPs threatens to vote against the Bill unless it is amended in a manner which is contrary to the Government's position. Miss a turn whilst you decide your next move.

Just before Introduction you realise that the ENs do not contain the analysis needed for the purposes of EVEL. Roll the dice: roll 4 to 6, you are able to add this to the ENs in time, move forward 2 spaces; roll 1 to 3, you are not ready in time: move backwards 1 space.
